title: WordCamp Bilbao
content:
This will be the second WordCamp Bilbao and fully organized by the WordPress Bilbao Community!

Looking forward to offer a great environment for learning and share WordPress knowledge and to enjoy one of the best and most beautiful cities of the north of Spain.

We will have a day for Tourism in the Guggenheim Museum and around the old part of the city.

See you in May! :)

title: WordCamp São Paulo
content:
Em sua quinta edição, o WordCamp São Paulo será o maior evento de WordPress já sediado no Brasil.

A edição 2015 do evento reuniu cerca de 280 participantes, e a meta para este ano é que haja 750 participantes no evento, esse número coloca o WordCamp São Paulo entre os 6 maiores do mundo.

O evento acontecerá no dia 10 de Dezembro, a partir das 8h da manhã.

In its fifth edition, the WordCamp São Paulo will be the biggest conference about WordPress of Brazil.

Its 2015 edition brought 280 attendees together and the 2016 goal is to increase that number to 750 attendees. That number puts WordCamp São Paulo among the six biggest WordCamps.

The conference will take place on December, 10th, starting at 8am.

title: WordCamp Miami, FL
content:
WordCamp Miami has become one of the largest tech related events in South Florida, and among the largest WordCamps in North America. In 2016, WCMIA brought over 800 bloggers, designers, developers, and together from across the area and beyond into sunny South Florida. Surrounded by beautiful weather along with a fun and addictive nightlife, Miami is a great location for WordPress folks – both new and old – to get together and share knowledge.

In 2017, we are keeping the event fresh and interesting. WordCamp Miami is reinventing itself with new session formats, new speakers and plenty of new friends. Not to mention some surprises as well. Join us!

title: WordCamp Mumbai
content:
WordCamp Mumbai is the longest running WordCamp in India. 2017 will see the fifth WordCamp here in Mumbai. This two day single track event will see participation from across India and the global as connectivity to Mumbai is better than most Indian Metros given it’s “Financial Capital of India” Status.

We invite WordPress enthusiasts, blogger, Developers and anyone with interest in our favorite CMS to come see and experience what our vibrant WordPress Community has in stall for you across two days on 25th – 26th March 2017 .

title: WordCamp Bordeaux

author.name: fxbenard
author.description: WordPress Translations GTE. I translate into French and code all i18n() functions. EDD, Mailpoet, Yoast, Gravity Forms and many others luv my skills.

content:
The very first edition of WordCamp Bordeaux will take place on March 18, 2017.

Our goal: bringing the local communities together to create a professional event around WordPress.

Whether you’re a beginner or an advanced user, whether you use WordPress for personal or professional projects. You are welcome to come and share our common passion.

Do you want to talk about WordPress? Discover the most use CMS in the world? Come and join us! We are expecting 300 people and we’ll be happy you be one of them.

Never come to Bordeaux? It’s never too late to enjoy one the most attractive city in the world as mentioned in a famous city guide this year.

Don’t forget to subscribe to our newsletter as well, we don’t want you to miss the opening day of the ticket sales!

title: WordCamp Nairobi
content:
A time has come for Nairobi to meet WordPress right in our backyard.
WordCamp Nairobi will be a two-days conference that will be held on 1st-2nd
of December at PAWA 254 in the heart of Nairobi. This conference targets
the people who: Use WordPress, Design WordPress, Develop WordPress, Blog
on WordPress, Like WordPress, Have a business website on WordPress or Want
to learn WordPress.

WordCamp Nairobi will be a casual conference covering everything related
to WordPress, the free and open source publishing software that powers more
than 25% of the internet. By the end of the Two-day event, we hope to have
built a stronger community of WordPress users in Nairobi and around. The
event will be recorded live and the video shared on
http://wordpress.tv/.

title: WordCamp Atlanta

author.name: kdrewien
author.description: speaker | trainer | cheeseslave| patient non-geeky teacher | WordPress fanatic | sweet tea lover | believes success is teamwork | loves to laugh | enjoys eating

content:
There’s going to be a rainbow over Atlanta from Friday, March 17 to Sunday, March 19. Simply follow it to the end, and you’ll find yourself at downtown’s Loudermilk Center. There, you and 600 of your smartest, friendliest colleagues will be amply rewarded.

Gold comes in many forms

Everyone attending will fill their pockets with golden nuggets of information and insight. That investment in new skills, ideas and resources will continue to pay off, with fresh ways to grow, and profit from, our businesses.

WordCamp volunteers have the opportunity to dig deeper into the Atlanta WordPress community’s inner circle. It’s a wonderful way to give something back, truly connect with other committed people, and perhaps even develop leadership skills.

Sponsors will have a wealth of options for getting the word out to their perfect audience. Lots of folks here would love to know how your products and services can enhance and expand their own capabilities.

And finally, speakers are the bright golden stars of WordCamp. There’s no better way to contribute to  the WordPress universe than to share your unique approach, so others may grow, and build upon it, in a continuous upward spiral of knowledge.

WordCamps are casual, locally-organized conferences that are organized by local WordPress users, developers and fans. Everyone from blogging newbies to professional WordPress developers and consultants participate, share ideas, and get to know each other.

We invite the local and regional community to come down and participate in this special WordPress experience. We hope this will be the first of many more to come!

title: WordCamp Kathmandu
content:
WordCamp Kathmandu, Nepal will make its debut on 19th of November 2016. It is one-day conference about WordPress, organized with the aim of attracting developers, designers, web professionals, bloggers and WordPress enthusiasts from all over Nepal and beyond for a weekend to absolutely geek-out.

This will not be the first ever WordCamp in Nepal though. WordCamps in Nepal were organized under the name of WordCamp Nepal and had been since the formation of WordPress Nepal in 2011. But starting this year, in order to encourage other smaller communities in the country as per an unofficial announcement by WordCamp Central, the concept of WordCamp Kathmandu was born.

title: WordCamp Fayetteville
content:
WordCamp Fayetteville will take place from July 22-24, at the Donald W. Reynolds Center for Enterprise Development on the University of Arkansas campus and various locations in Fayetteville. We’ll have a Meet-and-Greet Friday night, Classes all day Saturday, an after party in the evening, and a Jam Session on Sunday.

Everyone is welcome! If you use WordPress, build with WordPress, or just wonder about WordPress, you’ll enjoy attending. If you want to reach out to the Northwest Arkansas tech and business communities, you’re welcome to sponsor.

title: WordCamp Johannesburg
content:
WordPress is the most popular open source software in the world as more than 75 million websites and blogs on the Internet use WordPress.

WordCamps are informal, community-organized events that are put together by WordPress users and includes everyone from casual users to core developers participate, share ideas, and get to know each other.

On November 18-19, 2016, the Gauteng WordPress community, (the largest WordPress Group in Africa) will converge in Johannesburg for the 2016 Johannesburg WordCamp.  Johannesburg is the considered the financial capital of Africa and this will be the first WordCamp in Johannesburg and the second in Africa as Cape Town’s WordCamp took place in September. We have a good speaker lineup from community users to large complex media and newspaper multi sites who will discuss a variety of interesting topics touching on personal experience, e commerce installation, page builders and programming on the WordPress platform.   http://2016.johannesburg.wordcamp.org

title: WordCamp Milano
content:
WordCamp Milano is a two-day event for users, developers, designers, and everyone who uses – or is interested in using – WordPress.

Your level of expertise doesn’t matter: join us, to learn, network, and have some fun in beautiful Milano!

We will hold our Contributor Day on Friday, October 21, which is an excellent opportunity to start (or continue) to contribute to the Open Source project. The 2-track conference will be on Saturday, October 22nd.

And if your Italian is not the best, no worries! There will be talks in English too :)

Ciao! Ci vediamo a Milano!

content:
Belo Horizonte, the third largest economic center of Brazil, the capital of Minas Gerais, and forever marked by the famous Germany 7-1 Brazil. Minas Gerais is known for rum, cheeses, historical centers, quiet life and one of the largest iron and gold exporters.

And be sure to enjoy the genuine and warm Brazilian reception.

title: WordCamp Nashville

author.name: D'nelle Dowis
author.description: D’nelle is the chief distiller of awesomesauce at Berry Interesting Productions, where she nurtures little website seedlings into healthy, hardy WordPress blossoms. She works from anywhere there’s wifi, fancying herself location-independent, but can most often be found kicking around Inglewood, occasionally with her husband, Chris and/or their dogs, Annie & Cece, in tow. She loves sunshine, yoga, Apple products, and the oxford comma all a little too much.

content:
WordCamp Nashville 2016 is shaping up to be the best one yet. This two-day event, held the weekend of September 17-18, and organized by members of the Nashville WordPress MeetUp, will have something for everybody.

Attendees from past years will be familiar with the Saturday programming, with three “tracks” to accommodate users of various skill sets, each track featuring a variety of sessions that are either 50- or 20- minutes long, depending on the topic presented.

Day 2 on Sunday will feature small, hands-on, in-depth classes where users can actively participate on their own computers with an instructor to guide their work. Day 2 will also feature a Core Contribution and Community Organizing workshop, where attendees can learn how to give back to the global and local WordPress Community. Both days will feature a Help Desk
where more seasoned WordPress users will be available to help newer users with questions, one on one.

BANNER PHOTO CREDIT: Derrick Brutel

This WordCamp is planned to contain unconference, hands-on style sessions, and contribution days to get more opportunities of discussion and practice. Also, it is for everyone that is looking to up their WordPress skills and connect with the friendly community that helps make WordPress.

Come join in us! We look forward to meeting you!
